arm_group.description:
OFDI-guided PCI and assessment by OFDI at pre-PCI and post-PCI
Follow-up contact at the time of hospital discharge, 8 months and 12 months after PCI.

IVUS-guided PCI and assessment by IVUS at pre-PCI and post-PCI
Follow-up contact at the time of hospital discharge, 8 months and 12 months after PCI.

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this randomized study is to evaluate the impact of Optical frequency domain
      imaging (OFDI) guidance for Percutaneous Coronay Intervention (PCI) with drug-eluting stent
      (DES) as compared with Intravascular ultrasound (IVUS) guidance.

clinical_study.brief_title: OPtical Frequency Domain Imaging vs. INtravascular Ultrasound in Percutaneous Coronary InterventiON

detailed_description.textblock:
Optical frequency domain imaging (OFDI) is a novel, high resolution intravascular imaging
      modality. Intravascular ultrasound (IVUS) is a widely used conventional imaging modality for
      achieving optimal stent deployment.

      The aim of this randomized study is to evaluate the impact of OFDI guidance for Percutaneous
      Coronay Intervention (PCI) with drug-eluting stent (DES) as compared with IVUS guidance.

      We will enroll 800 patients with a de novo lesion who will undergo PCI with DES as is
      routine practice. Patients will be rondomely assigned to either OFDI-guided PCI arm or
      IVUS-guided PCI arm.

      Patients will then have a follow-up contact at the time of hospital discharge, 8 month and
      12 month after PCI.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with a de novo lesion (in the native coronary circulation) and planned to
             undergo drug-eluting stent implantation for indications according to the Japan and
             USA guidelines

          -  Patients aged between 20 and 85 years old

          -  Patients who has provided written informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with Acute Myocardial Infarction (AMI) within 3 months

          -  Patients with cardiogenic shock

          -  Patients with chronic heart failure

          -  Patients with renal failure (eGFR <= 30 ml/min/1.73 m2 or Serum creatinine level
             >=1.5mg/dL)

          -  Patients who are currently enrolled in other clinical trial which has possibility to
             influence the primary endpoint of OPINION trial.

          -  Patients planned use of bare metal stent

          -  Patients with 3-vessel diseases

          -  Planned surgery within 1 year

          -  Patient on dialysis

          -  Target lesion such as:

               -  Left main coronary artery

               -  Aorto-Ostial lesion location within 3mm of the aorta junction

               -  Chronic total occlusion

               -  Small vessel (reference vessel diameter <2.5mm)

               -  Coronary artery bypass graft

intervention.description:
OFDI-guided PCI and assessment by OFDI at pre-PCI and post-PCI
Follow-up contact at the time of hospital discharge, 8 months and 12months after PCI

IVUS-guided PCI and assessment by IVUS at pre-PCI and post-PCI
Follow-up contact at the time of hospital discharge, 8 months and 12months after PCI

clinical_study.official_title: OPtical Frequency Domain Imaging vs. INtravascular Ultrasound in Percutaneous Coronary InterventiON (OPINION)

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Ethics Committee of Wakayama Medical University

primary_outcome.description: The composite endpoint comprised of cardiac death, target vessel-related myocardial infarction (MI) and clinically-driven target vessel revascularization (TVR)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: MACE (composite of cardiac death, MI, TLR)

clinical_study.source: Translational Research Informatics Center, Kobe, Hyogo, Japan

lead_sponsor.agency: Translational Research Informatics Center, Kobe, Hyogo, Japan

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
